paper.title: Older adults at risk of Covid-19 and their socioeconomic ans family vulnerabilities: an analysis with MHAS
paper.abstract: The objective of this manuscript is to analyze the socioeconomic and family characteristics of population aged 50 years and older who are at high risk of testing positive for Covid-19, being hospitalized, or intubated in Mexico. We used two sources of information, the database of the Ministry of Health on Covid-19 and the Mexican Health and Aging Study in Mexico. We use the first to estimated regression models to calculate the risk of Covid-19, and these are applied in the second to analyze socioeconomic and family vulnerabilities. Results show that gender and age are strong predictors of high risk. Those with less schooling, those who work without a fixed physical place, those who perceive their economic situation as fair or bad, those who live in single-person households, and those who receive financial and no-financial help from their children are presented as a highly vulnerable group to Covid-19 and its repercussions.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是老年人在Covid-19中的社会经济和家庭脆弱性，使用了回归模型来分析健康风险和社会经济因素，并未涉及衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等金融领域。
